name: rizzle
text: most epic Achewood strip award

name: nyu
text: Word. Wasn't this the only arc to crash the achewood servers?

name: rizzle
text:
Beef and Ray were so legit they burned down the servers too?
God I wish I knew about Achewood back then

name: overmedicated
text: word.

name: saint
text:
who would need NoDoz during the Great Outdoor Fight, may I ask? what, is it not exciting enough?
{panel 2, for anyone that doesn't know where I'm coming from}

name: belgand
text: Well, I assume that some of the fighters get a bit of sleep at night and during the later days I suspect that people become a bit more wary and there's less of the raw, full-on brawling of the earlier days.

name: weretrout
text:
Sleep?
I thought it was a johnny wrapper

name: footbullet
text: The guy who bought the turkey and brandy had NoDoz on his receipt. Chances are that turkey had been sweating away in the back of the very truck that Ray and Beef storm to victory in.

name: bhlaab
text: on forums and such people were agonizing over the "meaning" of nodoz being listed on the receipt because they are internet people and refused to recognize it as a gag

name: tellumo
text: I believe Onstad employed the phrase " crankcase fire ".

name: hellaedgar
text: Oh dang I didn't know that. I think I didn't check the strip until that night.

name: from_circumstances
text: Best Steve McQueen movie EVER.

name: carlyle
text: That of course explains why none of the strips are in the most commented or the most viewed.

name: anathan
text: That Jeep is badass!!

name: iorek
text: it is, but only because everything about this arc is badass.

name: mr_pete
text: A comment left by mr_pete was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, Sakana, Gompo, fosters, cryptfiend85, BillyLK, Saint, motts)

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Vymora, madnes, riotdejaneiro, Gompo, mortshire, bug, unalone, MortisInvictus, atticusonline, Firehawk, hannah, Direhaggis, Doc_Rostov, Crimson_King)

name: hellofyellin
text: A comment left by hellofyellin was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Homepie, cryptfiend85, Saint)

name: kardlonoc
text: Oh fuck yeah,a legend is born!

name: spinynorman
text: Beef's from California and from Circumstances, so, sure, he knows how to handle small caliber pistols

name: norsef
text: But isn't Beef really scared about guns partly because his mum shot his dad and partly because he keeps getting shot?

name: i_love_kate
text: You'd think so, but Beef would shoot you, and you'd be wrong.

name: evilbobikus
text: I think that gun-skill just came to Beef on the spot.  The Beef who not comprehend going against the GOF has swiftly faded away in awe of Ray's defiance, and the raw hardcore Beef that carried Ray to day 3 makes its return.

name: w_w
text: It does seem as though Roast Beef attacked the tower on his own initiative (rather than simply escape).

name: kardlonoc
text: A comment left by kardlonoc was marked as spam and excluded. kardlonoc: What a douche. (reported by TVsIan, Magb, Saint)

name: senseihollywood
text: this one reminds me of summer camp...

name: thicker
text: I was wondering where the no-doz (from the receipt) were - brilliant

name: noah_j
text: there is a quiet connectedness to all of achewood, and i feel like the no-doze thing is my favorite example thereof.

name: nabeel84
text: This is first time I noticed so many onomatopoeia sounds in an Achewood strip. Usually there are never any.

name: joamiq
text: ?? Onstad uses onomatopoeia ALL the time.

name: rocketbunny
text: Not noticing it is a testament to how well he does it, I think. It's seamless. I often don't notice them... I just hear the onomatopoeia in my mind, and it isn't obtrusive.

name: nurdbot
text: It's like the ending of every awesome action movie ever. But with cats. Cats that can drive!

name: vreeeee
text: Check out my cameo in panel five.

name: miku224
text: This is one of the few comments on Achewood that I ALWAYS remember. When the previous strip loaded I got excited, thinking "man! This is the one with vreeeee's cameo!"

name: sargasm
text:
pouf

(closure)

name: phthoggos
text: There's an undergraduate thesis waiting to be written on the recurring motif of "pouf" in this arc

name: tombsgrave
text: The Waiting Motorscooter is a powerful archetypal symbol.

name: tekende
text: Maybe it's a floating signifier, right, achilleselbow?

name: qingofchina
text: Ray is in a pork pie hat again.

name: steerpike66
text: The Great Outdoor Fight was my introduction to Achewood. From dried store-bought turkey to 'Hush Ray' to tearing off people's jaws to this barnstorming high-octane conclusion, I have never looked back.

name: estutius
text: Son of Rodney: The dude so raw he kicked the Fight's ass.

name: cousinted
text: Song Cue: "Cities on Flame" -Blue Oyster Cult

name: stuart
text: Nah, Cities on Flame is a bit too slow to really do this strip justice. I'd go more with something like Pantera's Cowboys from Hell or, the ultimate rampage song, Search and Destroy by Iggy Pop and the Stooges.

name: tekende
text: "Set Fire to the Face on Fire" by Blood Brothers

name: gormster
text: A comment left by gormster was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, pitseleh, cailetshadow, Direhaggis, motts, Crimson_King)

name: pitseleh
text: After all the things that have happened in this entire arc, you couldn't have suspended your disbelief for this as well?

name: phthoggos
text: I guess you have never seen an action movie

name: cousinted
text: We simply must retain believability in this comic about talking cats and alive stuffed animals

name: atmus
text: It was actually diesel fuel, which doesn't vaporize as readily as gasoline.  The handgun was most likely loaded with tracer ammunition, which does burn hot enough to ignite diesel fuel.  I claim that it is loaded with tracer ammunition because it's really fun to shoot off at night for a guy all hopped up on no-doze in the desert with nothing to do but watch  Thomas the Tank Engine with some beat up dudes.

name: stormagnet
text: DAMN, but there are not enough chubbies in the world for that takedown. Thank you.

name: javonathan
text:
I thought Beef didn't like guns?
http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uuaVlpMjW

name: woodenteeth
text: oh! wait! If that really was Ray's Dad's arm going for the keys of the jeep a few strips back... does this mean Ray killed his Dad. That's pretty heavy.

name: judasburrito
text:
http://achewood.com/index.php?date=11292001
I've got vivarin and a pistol! Let's go!

name: killingthejay
text: a time-honored combination.

name: crawfomp
text: Some very impressive left-handed marksmanship by Beef there.  This would be the most natural way to operate a firearm while sitting in the driver's seat, however.

name: terriblerobot
text: Wasn't it shown in an earlier (later?) strip that Beef is in fact left-handed? In that case, shooting a gun left-handed would be perfectly natural.

name: thatcrazycommie
text: I recommend reading to this strip while listening to the opening of "Break" by Fugazi.

name: falseprophet
text: The overall ranking is only 4.7 man? Fuck, who is fucking up the goddamn average? Bitches need to get their Prince Alberts twisted.

name: wulvaine
text: Ouch beyond reason. And yes, this strip deserves a perfect 5, as far as I'm concerned.

name: evolume
text: KOODGE!

name: baryonyx
text: KROOOSH! actually.

name: vermy
text: The pacing of this strip is uncanny

name: tellumo
text: ( "Battle Without Honor or Humanity (Fight Theme from Kill Bill)" plays in the background)

name: tellumo
text: other candidates I have come up with include "Duel of the Fates" from the Phantom Menace soundtrack, and the timeless classics, "Theme from Rocky " and "Eye of the Tiger."

name: direhaggis
text: Guaranteed Ray-and-Roast-Beef-style blowjob.

name: nothingman
text: Are they going to use the sidecar or blow it up as well? The possibilities are... limited!

name: atticusonline
text: no finer onomateopia was ever onomateopiad

name: onepapertiger
text: this was a clever sentence, people. I am all about the Golden Rule.

name: catjumpjohn
text: Hella continuity on the No-Doz in the back of the Jeep and the No-Doz on the receipt.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Exactly. I only just noticed that this time around. I'd wondered what happened to it, I just never made the connection.

name: mustakrakesh
text: Panel 2 is fantastic, this is the best fucking comic ever!!!

name: thehelmet
text: So does the alt text actually refer to Carthage?

name: tellumo
text: Carthaginians thank their various gods that they got off as easy as they did, when they see the unremitting, relentless destruction that Ray and Beef unleashed on the Acres.

name: lahnnabell
text: so it seems we now know who purchased ray's christian brothers and chicken.  awesome tie-back.

name: twells
text:
Genesis 19:24-25.

24Then the LORD rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah brimstone and fire from the LORD out of heaven;
25And he threw down those cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew upon the ground.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: it muft sizzle.
